summary:
In 2014 I finished my masters degree in history. My academic schooling makes me an expert at academic research and writing. I am a naturally curious and studious person that is able to work in an organised fashion to complete certain tasks. These qualities and interest in history led me to work in archives. After a period of working on the so-called 'backside', selecting and describing static records at Doc-Direkt, I recently made a switch to taking a more active part in the world of archive. At Wageningen University and Research I contribute to archive policies and advise different departments as a Recordmanager.

My colleagues and friends describe me as a sociable person and a good listener. Besides that I also have a good sense of humor and am able to put things in perspective.
My specialties are academic research and writing, combined with my precision and drive. These qualities have served me well in my job at Doc-Direkt and will also help me in my new job.

Contact information
You can contact me by sending an email to alowenthal@live.nl. You are of course also welcome to send me a message via Linkedin.

projects.description: This blog contains the short stories I have written. I wanted to combine my enthusiasm for history, research and writing. On the blog I publish stories about all kinds of subjects relating - in one way or another - to history.

projects.title: Masterthesis - Clement re-examined. A re-examination of the traditional view on Pope Clement VII and his pontificate
projects.description: Research into whether or not the negative reputation of pope Clement VII is deserved, using source material from the Clement's time and contemporary literature.

projects.title: Bachelorthesis - Staat achter elke succesvolle man een sterke vrouw? Livia’s invloed op de besluitvorming van Octavianus/Augustus.
projects.description: I researched the amount of influence Livia had on the (political) decisions of her husband, the      Roman emperor Augustus. For this research I used ancient literary and material sources and contemporary literature.

volunteer_experiences.description: I write short articles concerning the importance and impact of history for today's society. The specific topics range from recent historical discoveries to for instance the changes made by Napoleon that still influence us today.

I teach guest lectures for the project 'Romeinse Spelen' from RomeinenNu. The lectures are about the Roman Games and are given on primary school throughout the Nijmegen area. During three lessons of apporximately one hour each, I teach the pupils about Roman sports, introduce them to source material, assist them with their assignments and lead class discussions.
For the event 024Geschiedenis a colleague from HistNow and I gave a free lecture with the title 'The history of tomorrow. How people in the past dreamed about the future.'
